cluster_relations.rel_desc: Participation in sports fosters a sense of community.

qualifiers.CausalHint: served as a powerful means of

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Sports promote the value of teamwork.
Sports promote the value of discipline.
Sports promote the value of fair play.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The subject activity or domain fosters, encourages, or contributes to the development or strengthening of the object value, attitude, or social outcome.
args.justification: All four relations describe sports as causally fostering or encouraging positive values or social outcomes (sense of community, teamwork, discipline, fair play). They share the same direction (sports → value/outcome) and positive, value-oriented promotion semantics, so they can be normalized under one canonical predicate 'promotes'.

In each case, the relation links sports to promoted social values or outcomes (teamwork, discipline, fair play, sense of community). This is more specific than a generic causal class and captures that the effect concerns social or moral values promoted by participation in sports.

The relations encode that engaging in sports brings about or strengthens specific values and social outcomes (rather than merely co-occurring with them), which is inherently causal: sports causally promotes these values.
